page.title: 03ATTITUDES TO LIFE IN WYTHALL
page.content: Most people thought it is a good place to live, because it is near the country and towns such as Redditch and B'ham.They also thought it was handy for places of interest and entertain ment. The farmers complained a bit about the land being such heavy soil. It is in the {Green Belt} and should remain so.The 2 big towns could join in the future but more land should be kept for recreation like fishing and parks.Already the building of the M42 has affected many of the farmers and destroyed the landscape for many years to come.Many people felt that the benefit of the M42 would be to remove much of the heavy traffic from the local roads.In general most people liked Wythall as a place to live and wouldn't want to see it changed. {Silvermead and Meadow Green.}
